text: these people didn't free war they fled
countries where they thought that their
governments didn't give them
opportunities to improve their standards
of living the lack of education the lack
of jobs so whatever they're from in West
Africa migrants start their journey on
buses they go all the way to Agra des
because they know it as a starting point
to get smuggled into Libya there they're
being picked up by the traffickers
networks they have to pay them it
usually is between four hundred five
hundred dollars it's basically like the
first see that they have to cross but
it's a sea of sand two thousand
kilometres nearly two thousand
kilometres of desert all the way to
Libya imagine being crammed on the top
of a track the lack of awareness the
lack of knowledge about what's ahead of
them
simply they don't want to hear about it
they know for some of them that people
are drowned in the sea or some people
have died in the deserts but they don't
want to hear about it they focus on that
friend who has been posted updates on
their Facebook profile from Germany from
Italy from France or elsewhere in Europe
and they believe that they can make it
too
